chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Mathew L Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Disarming a Peace Officer [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.21.
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: State

Defendant Mathew L Turner in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA states parties' recommendation for 11 mo, 15 days jail with 170 days credit. Atty. M notes def is hoping for admission into treatment court in Grant County. Court orders 11 months, 15 days on count 1, 9 months on counts 2, and 9 months on count 3, all concurrent and all with 170 days credit concurrent. Huber.
AMENDED - "Date offender granted status: 01/13/2017"
to Produce/Transport
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 20, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
email from Atty McDougal re scheduling SAR on 9-20-17
RCSD dispo of warrant
Judge Sharp's response to Def's letter request for modification of conditional jail time
from Def to the Court - request to modify condition time imposed in June 2016
Letter from MLT to Judge Sharp (furlough request); 12/15/16 - request denied and relayed to Grant Co. Jail via fax and phone

Defendant Mathew L Turner in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states there's no agreement between the parties on sentencing; notes PSI was filed; says State would be okay with adjournment.  Atty. M states def was hoping to get this matter resolved today.  

Count 1 - 4 years probation, consecutive to sentence def is serving in Grant County

Counts 2 & 3 - 2 years probation on each, consecutive to Grant County sentence; 90 days conditional time on Count 2; conditional time consecutive to sentence in Grant County case.  

Conditions of probation:  attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming or counseling ordered by agent; AODA/follow through with recommendations of the counselor; $228 restitution to JH; pay costs of action; submit DNA sample at RCSD.

Felony admonishments provided.

7 days credit in the event of revocation.  Conditional jail time may be transferred to Grant County Jail.  Work release.
Sentencing hearing on June 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mathew L Turner in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states parties are prepared to waive prelim and go to plea with request for PSI and sentencing scheduling.

Prelim waived with colloquy on the record.

DA has filed the information with the Court.  Formal reading waived by the Defense.

Def pleads no contest to the three counts contained in the information.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.

PSI ordered.  Counsel note that Def is presently awaiting sentencing in a Grant County matter (June 22nd) and request to use the same PSI from that case for this case.  Specifically, counsel ask the Court to order Grant County PSI to be used for this case with the agent to provide a separate recommendation for this Richland County matter.  Court so orders.  Sentencing set for June 29th at 1:30.
(Information copy provided to the COC by the DA during today's hearing; DA provided Court with this document as well)
on the record
Adjourned initial appearance on June 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mathew L Turner in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M states this is DA Harper's case - she has extended an offer to the def; defense asks for adjournment to 6/1.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.
State
Adjourned initial appearance at 03-16-2016 03:30 pm

Defendant Mathew L Turner in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M states she hasn't yet reviewed the complaint; requests adjournment to 3/16.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Clerk notes, at 3:00 p.m., that this case was filed this morning downstairs, unbeknowns to DA's staff and COC staff that, upstairs in court, the DA had motioned for def's release from bond on indication that summons and complaint would be coming.  As such, there is no bond.  DA states that the initial appearance will be set for 1/20 with exact date/time communicated to COC office by DA.
